title: Science Learning Process Utilizing Generative AI-Based Self-Regulated Learning (SRL)

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary science knowledge and understanding of self-regulated learning concepts
context.additional_context: Conducted in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments, learning outcomes are measured through project-based assessment. Learners are set as students/job seekers, with integrated science education design tailored to the language domain

learning_goals: Learners can systematically apply self-regulated learning strategies using a generative AI chatbot (SRLbot).
Learners achieve at least a 20% improvement in science knowledge assessments upon completing the 6-month course.
Learners form learning habits by interacting with the SRLbot at least three times weekly.

Learners apply self-regulated learning strategies (goal-setting, feedback integration, time management) over 1–6 months, address a scientific problem (e.g., image classification optimization) in a 10-page report (introduction, methodology, results, reflection), and achieve 4+ points (5-point scale) in four of five rubric criteria (clarity, logic, applicability, creativity, reflection).

resources: Access Permissions for LMS (Learning Management System) Platforms
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
